name: 楊元森
objective:
This course covers the theory and practice of scientific visualization, which is the graphical process of creating effective visual representations of 2D and 3D scientific data sets. The course will teach students the techniques and tools for generating, manipulating, analyzing and displaying various types of data, such as scalar fields, vector fields, and images. The course will also introduce some topics related to machine learning and graphical processing unit (GPU). 

Due to AI technology, the way of writing programs is changing significantly. This course teaches students how to develop programs using AI technology and how to use techniques to effectively communicate with AI to complete multi-file project-based program development.
By the end of this course, students should be able to:

1. Use AI tool(s) to develop software. Learn skills to efficiently communicate with AI for generating programming code and multi-file software projects.
2. Apply appropriate visualization techniques for different types of data 
3. Use existing visualization software packages and libraries, including Python Matplotlib and Matlab.
4. Describe the current technical relationship between GPU, image processing, and machine learning.
schedule:
W1. Introduction to scientific visualization
W2. Visualization and data animation in Python using Matplotlib 
W3. Take-home exercise of Python and Matplotlib
W4. Basic computer vision machine learning 
W5. Memory layout of arrays in Numpy 
W6. Midterm
W7. Convolution and its hands-on exercise using Python and Numpy
W8. The MNIST problem and CNN refinement for the MNIST problem
W9. CNN parameters explanation, overfitting, and some solutions 
W10. Data augmentation and callback functions
W11. Transfer learning and hands-on exercise
W12. Image segmentation and hands-on exercise
W13. Image segmentation and hands-on exercise (ii)
W14. Image segmentation and hands-on exercise (iii)
W15. Generative Adversarial Network and generative AI 
W16: GPU for computer graphics and computer vision
W17: Parallel computing on CPUs and GPUs 
W18. Project presentations
scorePolicy:
1. Lecture activities (attendance, interaction, lecture assistance) (20% +/- 5%)
2. Midterm (20% +/- 5%)
3: Final Presentation: in classroom (25% +/- 5%)
4: Final Presentation: as a Youtuber (35% +/- 5%)
materials:
- The Visualization Toolkit: An Object-Oriented Approach to 3D Graphics by William Schroeder and Ken Martin

- Matplotlib official website: https://matplotlib.org/

- Matlab visualization official website: https://www.mathworks.com/products/matlab/matlab-graphics.html#visualize_data
課程是否導入AI: AI1：使用生成式 AI 作為教學過程的輔助工具（Use generative AI tools as an aid to the teaching process）AI2：鼓勵學生使用生成式 AI 工具（Encourage students to use generative AI tools）AI3：使用生成式 AI 進行課堂即時互動（Use generative AI for real-time classroom interaction）AI4：簡單介紹 AI 的基本概念（Briefly introduce the basic concept of AI）
